column1:
Localization files are formatted like CSV so they can be easily edited,
however formatting has strict rules for easy parsing. Most of these rules
are already handled by Excel / Libre / etc., so you don't have to worry
about them in normal usage. However, if your localization file seems to
be corrupted, these rules may be helpful for debugging purposes...
- In general, any consecutive string of \r and \n (in any order) will be
  treated as one SINGLE line break, except within an enclosed context
- The first 4 rows can be arbitrarily long
  - The first cell of first row is used to store this block of instruction
    text
  - The first 3 cells of the fourth row is used as headers
  - All other cells in the first and fourth rows are ignored
  - Columns in the second row alternate between property and value (ex.
    ' foo | 1 | bar | 3.5 | ... '
    - Any whitespaces before and after the property name are ignored
  - Columns in the third row are exclusively comments for properties in the
    second row
- Every following line can include any number of cells, but only the
  first three will be parsed (you can use the rest as comments if needed)
- The file must end in a sequence of \r and \n's
- Every cell containing a ^, \r, or \n must be enclosed in "
  - If a " is encountered right after a non-enclosed separator, \r, or \n,
    then the parser is said to enter an "enclosed context", such context
    ends immediately when a non-escaped " that is not followed by \r, \n,
    or a separator is encountered
  - " within each cell should be escaped using another " in front of it,
  - If a " is encountered in a non-enclosed context, and it is not right
    after a separator, \r, or \n, then it is entirely ignored
  - If a non-escaped " is encountered in an enclosed context...
    - If it is followed by a separator, \r, or \n, then it is considered
      the closing quote of the current context
    - Otherwise, it is ignored
  - If a separator, \r, or \n is encountered while in an enclosed context,
    it will be preserved

column3: NonDialogueFontScale

column1: Set to 1 allow the parser to read this file, otherwise it will be skipped and the default English localization will be used as fallback
column3: Float value that scales font size of all dialogue text, this is an option separate because the English font of this game is *really* tiny, like about 1/3 of regular font when under the same font size.
column5: Float value that scales font size of all dialogue text, this is an option separate because the English font of this game is *really* tiny, like about 1/3 of regular font when under the same font size. Recommended setting is around 0.3~0.6.

column2: My husband's a wizard! I'm so proud of him, even though it doesn't always pay the bills...
column3: My husband's a wizard! I'm so proud of him, even though it doesn't always pay the bills...

column2: I went to the burger unveiling, but some ruffian stole it! That dastardly criminal should pay for his crimes.
column3: I went to the burger unveiling, but some ruffian stole it! That dastardly criminal should pay for his crimes.

column2: Ah yes, the crystal, one of my most prized possessions. Can you have it? For a price...
column3: Ah yes, the crystal, one of my most prized possessions. Can you have it? For a price...

column2: Of <wavy>$1,000,000!</wavy> Good luck coming up with that money, chump!
column3: Of <wavy>$1,000,000!</wavy> Good luck coming up with that money, chump!

column2: Some wizards say you shall not pass. But money is money.
column3: Some wizards say you shall not pass. But money is money.

column2: The time has come to ponder.
column3: The time has come to ponder.

column2: If you wish true power, you must forgo what is most valuable.
column3: If you wish true power, you must forgo what is most valuable.

column2: Then, you may attain what you need.
column3: Then, you may attain what you need.

column2: <wavy>Welcome to the Reflection Pool.</wavy>
column3: <wavy>Welcome to the Reflection Pool.</wavy>

column2: <wavy>Before you proceed, you must fix this world one last time.</wavy>
column3: <wavy>Before you proceed, you must fix this world one last time.</wavy>

column2: <wavy>Welcome to the Reflection Pool.</wavy>
column3: <wavy>Welcome to the Reflection Pool.</wavy>

column2: <wavy>You desire... <var>Cat</var>.</wavy>
column3: <wavy>You desire... <var>Cat</var>.</wavy>

column2: <wavy>Though I do not have what you seek, I have the path forward.</wavy>
column3: <wavy>Though I do not have what you seek, I have the path forward.</wavy>

column2: <wavy>If you wish for <var>Cat</var>, then leave the Artifact here.</wavy>
column3: <wavy>If you wish for <var>Cat</var>, then leave the Artifact here.</wavy>

column2: <wavy>You have done this world a great service.</wavy>
column3: <wavy>You have done this world a great service.</wavy>

column2: <wavy>Goodbye, adventurer. May we one day meet again.</wavy>
column3: <wavy>Goodbye, adventurer. May we one day meet again.</wavy>

column1: Map/EightPuzzle/MagitechSTile (9)/All Tile Maps/House Tile Maps/Decorations/House1 bot right/Carly@4:2
column2: I can die in peace now. Thank you, explorer.
column3: I can die in peace now. Thank you, explorer.

column2: I hope you find <var>Cat</var> safely!
column3: I hope you find <var>Cat</var> safely!

column2: Are you really going to space?
column3: Are you really going to space?

column2: There's always something to fix...
column3: There's always something to fix...

column2: H- Hello? Who are you?
column3: H- Hello? Who are you?

column2: Don't mind me, I'm not from around here either.
column3: Don't mind me, I'm not from around here either.

column2: We've finally finished unpacking our research equipment.
column3: We've finally finished unpacking our research equipment.

column2: I'm investigating entangled items!
column3: I'm investigating entangled items!

column2: Whatttt, you wanted that gem? But it's already a part of the experiment!
column3: Whatttt, you wanted that gem? But it's already a part of the experiment!

column2: We managed to entangle a conductive bob somewhere, it should help in finishing this.
column3: We managed to entangle a conductive bob somewhere, it should help in finishing this.

column2: Aha, this appears to be the conductive bob from the present.
column3: Aha, this appears to be the conductive bob from the present.

column2: Aha, this appears to be the conductive bob from the past.
column3: Aha, this appears to be the conductive bob from the past.

column2: How fascinating! Moving the past item affects its future self.
column3: How fascinating! Moving the past item affects its future self.

column2: I will continue these expirments. We must understand it all.
column3: I will continue these expirments. We must understand it all.

column2: Dump truck delivered.
column3: Dump truck delivered.

column2: Oh jeez! My fire's dying but I don't have any wood.
column3: Oh jeez! My fire's dying but I don't have any wood.

column2: Yes!! Time to boil some noodles!
column3: Yes!! Time to boil some noodles!

column2: Mmmm, those noodles were de-lec-ta-ble!
column3: Mmmm, those noodles were de-lec-ta-ble!

column2: Studies suggest there are all kinds of relics still down there!
column3: Studies suggest there are all kinds of relics still down there!

column2: I hope there are dinosaurs too.
column3: I hope there are dinosaurs too.

column2: Good heavens, what are you doing?
column3: Good heavens, what are you doing?

column2: Some good weather for once at the MRI. How about a picnic for lunch Wags?
column3: Some good weather for once at the MRI. How about a picnic for lunch Wags?

column2: Believe it or not, magic is real! Alchemy too!
column3: Believe it or not, magic is real! Alchemy too!

column2: I heard you got permission to ride the rocket. Problem is, it has no fuel.
column3: I heard you got permission to ride the rocket. Problem is, it has no fuel.

column2: But! This here Gem-Fuel machine can convert magic gems into fuel for a rocket.
column3: But! This here Gem-Fuel machine can convert magic gems into fuel for a rocket.

column2: Here, go ahead and try putting that blue gem over there into the fuel converter.
column3: Here, go ahead and try putting that blue gem over there into the fuel converter.

column2: Once you find the other 8 gems, we can distill their essence into powerful, magical fuel!
column3: Once you find the other 8 gems, we can distill their essence into powerful, magical fuel!

column2: Take this <wavy>Gem Transporter</wavy>. It'll automatically teleport any gems you find to the alchemy machine.
column3: Take this <wavy>Gem Transporter</wavy>. It'll automatically teleport any gems you find to the alchemy machine.

column2: Here, let me take out that Ocean gem for you so you can try it out.
column3: Here, let me take out that Ocean gem for you so you can try it out.

column2: Good luck out there. Only <var>magiTechNumRemainingGems</var> gems left.
column3: Good luck out there. Only <var>magiTechNumRemainingGems</var> gems left.

column2: That Gem-Fuel Recipe! Where did you get it!?
column3: That Gem-Fuel Recipe! Where did you get it!?

column2: Hmm... it looks like we're a few gems short.
column3: Hmm... it looks like we're a few gems short.

column2: <var>MagitechGemFuelHint</var>
column3: <var>MagitechGemFuelHint</var>

column2: Aha, the Gem-Fuel Recipe! It's nearly complete!
column3: Aha, the Gem-Fuel Recipe! It's nearly complete!

column2: Once we get the final gem, we mix them and super-power the rocket.
column3: Once we get the final gem, we mix them and super-power the rocket.

column2: We just need the last gem! It should be in the past.
column3: We just need the last gem! It should be in the past.

column2: All of the gems are here! Let's get the Gem Fuel pumping!
column3: All of the gems are here! Let's get the Gem Fuel pumping!

column2: Say Barry, it's a fine day at the Magic Research Institute isn't it?
column3: Say Barry, it's a fine day at the Magic Research Institute isn't it?
